data.chText: 番茄使调味汁别有风味。
data.enText: The tomatoes give extra flavour to the sauce.

data.chText: 这比其他荷兰干酪的味道要浓。
data.enText: It is stronger in flavour than other Dutch cheeses.

data.chText: 这种酸奶有十种不同的味道。
data.enText: This yogurt comes in ten different flavours.

data.chText: 有淡淡的水果味的葡萄酒
data.enText: a wine with a delicate fruit flavour

data.chText: 南佛罗里达的独特风情
data.enText: the distinctive flavour of South Florida

data.chText: 外国客人使这个场合显出一种真正国际性的气氛。
data.enText: Foreign visitors help to give a truly international flavour to the occasion.
an idea of what sth is like

data.chText: 我试图表达某种类似论据的东西。
data.enText: I have tried to convey something of the flavour of the argument.
a particular type of sth, especially computer software
a person or thing that is very popular at a particular time

data.chText: 给（食物或饮料）调味；加味于
data.enText: to add sth to food or drink to give it more flavour or a particular flavour

ex.chText: 清咖啡会在嘴里留下一些苦味。
ex.enText: Black coffee leaves a bitter taste in the mouth.
Some fruits are disagreeable to the taste.
Modern paintings are not to my taste.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，主要指由人的味觉器官品尝出来的味道或滋味，常引申指某人的口味或爱好。

ex.enText: The tea has lost its flavour.

ex.chText: 这家店铺卖6种不同风味的冰激凌。
ex.enText: The shop sells ice cream in six different flavours.

ex.chText: 可以隐约觉得有一点柠檬味。
ex.enText: One can faintly discern the flavour of lemon.
These poems have the distinctive flavour of a ballad.

synonyms.bx: 指用嗅觉、味觉感受到的味道，尤指物品的某种特殊风味，或其味道中的特殊之处，常引申指某种事物的特色或特点。

ex.enText: The meat has lost its savour.

ex.chText: 面包闻起来最香，食盐的滋味最鲜。
ex.enText: The best smell is bread, the best savour salt.

ex.chText: 生活中似乎已失去了一些值得享受的乐趣.
ex.enText: Life seems to have lost some of its savour.

synonyms.bx: 尤指令人愉快的味道或气味，可引申指趣味、乐趣。

data.enText: a person or thing that is very popular at a particular time

tr: the taste experience when a savoury condiment is taken into the mouth
the general atmosphere of a place or situation and the effect that it has on people
example: the feel of the city excited him
a clergyman improved the tone of the meeting
it had the smell of treason
Season the chicken breast after roasting it

value.boxr_value: in AM, use 美国英语用flavor

value.def: The flavour of a food or drink is its taste.

example.ex: This cheese has a crumbly texture with a strong flavour...
example.tran: 这种奶酪口感松脆，味道浓郁。

example.ex: I always add some paprika for extra flavour.
example.tran: 我总是加一些辣椒粉来提味儿。

example.ex: ...drinks of rich colours and strong flavours.
example.tran: 颜色鲜艳、味道浓郁的饮料

value.def: If something is orange flavour or beef flavour, it is made to taste of orange or beef.
If you flavour food or drink, you add something to it to give it a particular taste.

example.ex: Flavour your favourite dishes with exotic herbs and spices...
example.tran: 把异国风味的芳草和香料加到你最喜爱的菜肴里调味。

example.ex: Lime preserved in salt is a north African speciality which is used to flavour chicken dishes.
example.tran: 盐渍的酸橙是北非的一种特产，在烹制鸡肉时用来调味。

value.def: You can refer to a special quality that something has as its flavour. For example, if something has an Italian flavour it reminds you of Italian things.

example.ex: ...a car with a flavour that is distinctly Italian.
example.tran: 带有明显意大利风格的轿车
带有 40 年代怀旧风格的服装

value.def: If something gives you a flavour of a subject, situation, or event, it gives you a general idea of what it is like.

example.ex: The book gives you a flavour of what alternative therapy is about.
example.tran: 这本书让你大致了解一下什么是替代疗法。

value.def: If you think that something or someone is very popular at a particular time, you can say that they are flavour of the month .

example.ex: Hats were very much flavour of the month...
example.tran: 帽子在当时是时尚热宠。

example.ex: Middlesex cricketers Gatting and Emburey are hardly flavour of the month.
example.tran: 米德尔塞克斯郡板球选手盖廷和恩伯里很难说是当红人物。

value.tran: 红极一时的人物;风靡一时的事物
